text: The Cathedral Basilica of St. Demetrius Cathedral Basilica of St. Demetrius () also called Sremska Mitrovica Cathedral is the name given to a religious building affiliated with the Catholic Church which is located in the city of Sremska Mitrovica in northern part of European country of Serbia. The temple follows the Roman or Latin rite and is the seat of the Catholic Diocese of Sirmium (Dioecesis Sirmiensis or Сремска бискупија) which was created in the fourth century and was restored by Pope Gregory IX in 1229. The current church was built in 1810 and dedicated on June 30 of that year to St. Demetrius, patron of the city. It was elevated to the status of co-cathedral in 1984, and a minor basilica in 1991. With the restoration of the Diocese of Sirmium in 2008, the church was elevated to cathedral. ==See also== *Roman Catholicism in Serbia *St. Demetrius Sveti Dimitrije Entrance ==References== Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Serbia Category:Buildings and structures in Sremska Mitrovica Category:Roman Catholic churches completed in 1810 Category:Basilica churches in Serbia
title: Cathedral Basilica of St. Demetrius, Sremska Mitrovica
